messages.message:
@shaunak can you help verify the resourcing done for MUFG dev environment? https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1CNRc3NptRSokra0-KhprCpO2jnXurIN0G_uIHzC_c80/edit?usp=sharing
They want everything to run on ocr-msft-v3 and they expect 100k pages a year of load.
Hi @Arora ji @sada why does MUFG team want everything to run using OCR MSFT v3? It is very expensive in terms of infra resources (4-5x of OCR v2). Have we explained this to them?
I think they will want the option to run either version. They currently don’t know there is a difference between 2 and 3
We won’t know which OCR engine to use until we start building the solutions for them

Suggested approach:
Our experience with the Dev env is going to unearth which OCR might be a good fit for them.
We'll fine-tune our reco for the UAT and Prod infra based on this experience.

Sounds good, @Varun Jain?

Yes, this is fine. PRE team will need the load split across both OCR versions for resourcing each environment. 

While making these assumption, please keep in mind there is a big cost to using MSFT OCR v3. 

Benefit either in performance or unblocking a use case (eg due to language support) should justify it. 

@Arora ji @Lee
All current solutions have been built using v2, its all in english and most docs are HQ, we can assume v2 for most use cases if the other costs are so high
@sada do you want me to look at the prod / uat breakdown
The dev would be our primary focus. But it would be nice if you can have a look at prod/uat overview.

Please let’s use OCR V2 - OCR V3 is not scalable and should be only used as a last resort, not as a preference. We really need to set this expectation right both internally within solution and sales eng and externally to our customers. If anyone has questions please reach out to me.
@Arora ji can you help here please?
There's no reason to go against this recommendation from @Kerry. Let's go with 100% v2 in that case.
